intro: Scorzonera octangularis, commonly known as the angular scorzonera, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, often hairy stems. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and features alternate, lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are yellow with dark centers, and it produces cylindrical, spiky fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Scorzonera octangularis is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to harsh, high-altitude environments.
